page.title: 09LAND USE
page.content: Area around Teggs Nose is hill farmland,steep valleys of cultivated grassland divided into irregular fields by dry gritstone walls following land contours.There is one working farm,Clough House & 5 17th century stone houses, former farms.There is also open grassland between encroachment of Macclesfields urban development & Teggs Nose Quarry.3 working farms here are mainly mixed farms concentrating on sheep & store cattle replacing former dependance on dairy cattle.At non-farming houses small parcels of land retained for domestic use & remainder let to working farms as Summer grazing.Area bordered by Sadlers Way,ancient pack horse salt trail now in process of being drained & paved as part of Teggs Nose Country Park.
